subject: Is Junit-based testing REALLY possible for commercial software development ?

Subject: Is Junit-based testing REALLY possible for commercial software development ?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=193176558; y=3BlD874L4h1HyKVnE5sdUvM0BeWUdMeMgY_SUJEdGAXMGJIXiQ

Hi all,

After lots of reading and trying, I think I understand the follow=
ing
benefits that Junit-base testing can give us:

* more robust system
* c=
lean / good design 
* less regression bugs 
* confidence to do refactorying=
, especially at the later phase of the
project. 
* and lots more...

These =
are really good things, for open-source projects where there is
no deadline=
 pressure and resource could almost be thought as
un-limitted. However, for=
 commercial software development, is this
still possible ?


Although I kne=
w JUnit and other JUnit-based open-source tools for a
couple of years, my c=
ompany and team never really enbrace it. The
major reason is Product Manage=
rs always want to add cool features to
the system quickly while programmers=
 find the schedule is always too
tight to spend any extra time to write tes=
ting. 

I know from the mail list and books that we can take lots of advant=
age
of JUnit-based testing, I myself have no real hands-on experience on
it=
. So here are my questions: 

* Will Junit-based testing make the project t=
ime longer or shorter ?
Any hard statistic data ? ( Here I mean commercial =
project rather than
open-source project. )

* One intersting point I found =
is that after Junit-based testing is
introduced, programmers tend to use ID=
E debugger much less than
before.  This would save lots of time. Is that tr=
ue ?

* Some guys say JUnit is good for biz / util code testing. But for we=
b
application development, where HTML/javascript would be root cause of
lot=
s of bugs, Junit is not so powerful. Any comments ? 

* How can I convince =
managers and programmers that JUnit-based is
really possible for commercial=
 software development ? Any differnece
from open-source projects ?


 
Can =
some Junit gurus shed some light here ?

Thanks, 
- Frank
